---
title: "VirtualiZarr examples"
---

## Overview

This workshop will include an explanation and exploration of VirtualiZarr 2.0.

You can find out more about VirtualiZarr on [readthedocs](https://virtualizarr.readthedocs.io/en/stable/index.html) and explore the
[source code on GitHub](https://github.com/zarr-developers/VirtualiZarr). If you're familiar with VirtualiZarr 1.0, check out the
[migration guide](https://virtualizarr.readthedocs.io/en/stable/migration_guide.html) for information about how this new release differs.

You can use the [VEDA Hub](https://docs.openveda.cloud/user-guide/scientific-computing/) to run the examples in this demo:

- Navigate to [https://hub.openveda.cloud/](https://hub.openveda.cloud/)
- Scroll to build your own image in the "Environment" dropdown
    - Enter for “repository”: https://github.com/NASA-IMPACT/dse-virtual-zarr-workshop
    - Enter for “Git Ref” (default): HEAD
    - Click build image
- Start a VEDA Hub with the “Build your own image option”
    - Select Resource Allocation (Default): 1.9 GB RAM, up to 3.7 CPUs
    - Click Start
- Download the source code from GitHub:

```bash
git clone git@github.com:NASA-IMPACT/dse-virtual-zarr-workshop.git
cd dse-virtual-zarr-workshop
```
